front.content: On dual carriageways (autopistas/autovías) with 2 lanes in each direction, where should cars and vehicles >3.5t drive?

back.content:
• In the right lane
• This applies both inside and outside urban areas

front.content: On dual carriageways (autopistas/autovías) with 3 lanes in each direction, where should cars and vehicles >3.5t drive?

back.content:
• In the right lane
• Central lane for overtaking or turning left
• Never in the left lane
• Applies both inside and outside urban areas

front.content: On conventional highways outside urban areas with more than one lane in the same direction, where should cars drive?

back.content:
• In the right lane
• Other lanes can be used when necessary

front.content: On conventional highways outside urban areas with 3+ lanes, where should lorries, minivans, and special vehicles >3.5t drive?

back.content:
• In the right lane
• Adjacent lane allowed exceptionally
• Never use remaining lanes
• Change lanes only when traffic requires

front.content: How should you drive around refuge islands or guidance devices on two-way streets?

back.content:
• Drive on the right side of these elements
• Leave them to your left
• This applies when they separate opposite directions of traffic

front.content: How can you drive around refuge islands or guidance devices on one-way streets or within a single direction of travel?

back.content:
• Driving is permitted on both the left and right sides of these elements
• This applies specifically to one-way streets or within the corresponding part of a single direction of travel

front.content: What are the rules for vehicles using the hard shoulder in Spain regarding driving in parallel and overtaking?

back.content:
• Driving in parallel on the hard shoulder is forbidden, except for bicycles and mopeds
• Overtaking on the hard shoulder is forbidden if it takes more than 15 seconds, except for bicycles

front.content: What are the rules for maintaining stopping gaps in Spain?

back.content:
• Maintain a gap large enough to allow for emergency braking
• Leave enough space to allow other vehicles to overtake
• Vehicles over 3.5 tonnes and longer than 10 meters must maintain a gap of at least 50 meters from the vehicle in front (outside urban areas)

front.content: What is the required safety distance in tunnels when not overtaking in Spain?

back.content: • Maintain a safety distance of at least 100 meters or 4 seconds from the vehicle in front

front.content: What are the general priority rules at junctions in Spain?

back.content:
• Priority is determined by traffic signs
• If no signs, vehicles approaching from the right have right of way
• Exceptions (vehicles that have priority):
  - Those on a main road over those on a secondary road
  - Those already in a roundabout over those entering
  - Those on motorways/dual carriageways over those joining
  - Those on a public road over those joining from a private road
• Do not enter a junction if your vehicle might obstruct other traffic
